name: lifelines
summary: Survival analysis in Python, including Kaplan Meier, Nelson Aalen and regression

chunks.text:
Documentation and intro to survival analysis

If you are new to survival analysis, wondering why it is useful, or are interested in *lifelines* examples, API, and syntax, please read the [Documentation and Tutorials page](http://lifelines.readthedocs.org/en/latest/index.html)

Contact

Development

See our [Contributing](https://github.com/CamDavidsonPilon/lifelines/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines.

usage_description:
Here is a 2-sentence summary of what a developer can achieve with this library:

This library is used to perform survival analysis in Python, allowing developers to model and analyze time-to-event data using techniques such as Kaplan Meier estimation and regression. With lifelines, developers can create robust and accurate models that capture the complexities of event-time data, enabling informed predictions and decision-making.
